abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and the institutional development
            impact substantial. Lessons identified feature the continued
            implementation of the coal sector reform, and, useful
            insights for future Bank operations to support coal sector
            reform. The comprehensive approach to coal sector reform
            taken by the government, should be maintained, as well as
            the Inter-Ministerial Coal Steering Committee, which
            provides a coordinated approach for addressing, and
            monitoring implementation issues. However, and although the
            current coal sector program showed positive initial signs,
            further employment restructuring, and mine closures, will be
            needed for full privatization, and viability of the
            industry. Voluntary employment restructuring has slowed
            down, and job creation in the regional economy needs
            particular attention: financial performance needs
            improvement, and budgetary constraints needs to be applied,
            to achieve privatization which would speed the
            Government's transfer of price risks to the private
            sector, protecting itself, and taxpayers from the risk of
            further subsidies. Careful consideration should be given if
            prime mines initiate the privatization process, for it could
            risk a large residual of unattractive mines. From an
            operational standpoint, the Bank is in a unique position to
            play a highly constructive role, given its experience in
            coal sector restructuring, and social mitigation, by
            bringing in skills, forging consensus, and, ensuring
            interactions prod privatization processes. It is suggested
            that a sector adjustment operation should be the instrument
            of choice, for it supports all the social, environmental,
            technical, and managerial aspects involved.
